name: Front-end Code - Run after the base node has been deployed. Sets up FE code and routes. \n See index.js for more example code and why one route deliberately errors.

Dynamically add a new route template & route config (NB: Config update currently only possible in front-end code, see index.js) \n Note 2 separate msgs because 2nd needs to use the msg.payload. Each must have a separate topic and the msg._ui must be deleted for the 2nd msg.
Example of changing route from Node-RED using UIBUILDER remote navigation command
Example of using a `uib-topic` attribute in HTML and sending dynamic changes from Node-RED
While you CAN load libraries from Node-RED, it isn't recommended as it may not be loaded soon enough
Flow to auto-generate a menu based on route files

template:

name: route07 template
template:
dynamically loaded from Node-RED

A template created in Node-RED and sent to clients using a uib-tag node to create the template via a uib-cache node. So (re)-loaded as needed.

Route 7 part 1
Route 7 part 2

info:
Change the "prop" value to a CSS Selector.

The display will appear as the last child of
that selected element.

e.g. `body` or `#more`.

name: Front-end router library tests and examples. \n After import, (1) change the URL in uibuilder node then deploy, (2) change the selection in the uib-save node and deploy again, \n (3) Run the Front-end Code flow. Example is then ready to use.
main-menu.html
template:
Menu

:
  • #1
  • #2
  • #3
  • #4
  • #5
  • #6
  • #md1
  • #md2

name: menu1.html
template:
Example Menu
  • #1 (Internal template)
  • #2 (Internal template)
  • #3 (External template)
  • #4 (fails as the external route template doesn't exist)
  • #5 (External template added by script, if pre-selected on load, will fail)
  • #6 (Internal template added by script, if pre-selected on load, will fail)
  • #md1 (Internal Markdown template)
  • #md2 (External Markdown template)

name: Change Footer HTML & attributes via uib-topic attribute in html
payload:
"
This is an HTML footer sent from Node-RED." & $formatInteger($random() * 100, "0") & "
"
info:
Change the "prop" value to a CSS Selector.

The display will appear as the last child of
that selected element.

e.g. `body` or `#more`.

name: route-md-01.md
template:
## This is Markdown Route 01

It is rendered only if the Markdown-IT library is loaded.

1. Num list a
1. Num list b

> [!TIP]
> Markdown routes have to be external files because they
> may contain characters that HTML uses for itself.

name: Use loadOther to load menu's from external files
External Markdown Templates. Load HighlightJS \n & Markdown-IT libraries to see them correctly rendered \n NB: Markdown routes have to be external due to HTML limitations
route-md-02.md
template:
## This is Markdown Route 2 Rendered by Markdown-IT. * List 1 * List 2 ```js // Some example JavaScript in a code block const myvar = 42 if (myvar > 40) { console.log('Phew! Old') } ``` ```html
  1. List Item #1
  2. List Item #2
  3. List Item #3
``` > Note: > > The HighlightJS library and CSS must be pre-loaded > for the code blocks to render nicely.
